The research found that RS had a sensitivity of 82% and a specificity of 83% in distinguishing prostate from extraprostatic tissue, and a sensitivity of 87% and a specificity of 86% in distinguishing benign from malignant tissue. Based on these metrics, the research suggests that RS has the potential to be an appropriate tool for the diagnosis and possibly grading of prostate cancer.
